verses.devanagari: ईशावास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत् । तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथाः मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम् ॥
verses.iast: īśāvāsyam idaṁ sarvaṁ yat kiñca jagatyāṁ jagat | tena tyaktena bhuñjīthāḥ mā gṛdhaḥ kasyasvid dhanam ||
verses.translation: All this—whatever moves in this moving world—is pervaded by the Lord. Enjoy (protect) through renunciation; do not covet anyone’s wealth.

verses.devanagari: कुर्वन्नेव इह कर्माणि जिजीविषेच्छतं समाः । एवं त्वयि नान्यथेतोऽस्ति न कर्म लिप्यते नरे ॥
verses.iast: kurvann eveha karmāṇi jijīviṣec chataṁ samāḥ | evaṁ tvayi nānyatheto 'sti na karma lipyate nare ||
verses.translation: By doing works here one should wish to live a hundred years. Thus there is no other way for you; action does not cling to a person so living.

verses.devanagari: असूर्या नाम ते लोका अन्धेन तमसाऽवृताः । तान् ते प्रेत्याभिगच्छन्ति ये के चात्महनो जनाः ॥
verses.iast: asūryā nāma te lokā andhena tamasāvṛtāḥ | tān te pretyābhigacchanti ye ke cātma-hano janāḥ ||
verses.translation: Sunless are those worlds, enveloped in blind darkness; to them go, after death, those who slay the Self.

verses.devanagari: अनेजदेकं मनसो जवीयो नैनं देवा आप्नुवन् पूर्वमर्षत् । तद्धावतोऽन्यानत्येति तिष्ठत् तस्मिन्नपो मातरिश्वा दधाति ॥
verses.iast: anejad ekaṁ manaso javīyo nainaṁ devā āpnuvan pūrvam arṣat | tad dhāvato 'nyān atyeti tiṣṭhat tasminn apo mātariśvā dadhāti ||
verses.translation: Unmoving, the One—swifter than the mind. The gods reach It not, for It ever goes before; standing, It outstrips others as they run. In It the Wind places the waters.

verses.devanagari: तदेजति तन्नैजति तद्दूरे तद्वन्तिके । तदन्तरस्य सर्वस्य तदु सर्वस्य बाह्यतः ॥
verses.iast: tad ejati tan naijati tad dūre tad v antike | tad antar asya sarvasya tad u sarvasya bāhyataḥ ||
verses.translation: That moves and That moves not; That is far, and That is near. That is within this all, and That is also outside all.

verses.devanagari: यस्तु सर्वाणि भूतान्यात्मन्येवाऽनुपश्यति । सर्वभूतेषु चात्मानं ततो न विजुगुप्सते ॥
verses.iast: yas tu sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmanyevānupaśyati | sarva-bhūteṣu cātmānaṁ tato na vijugupsate ||
verses.translation: But whoever sees all beings in the Self alone, and the Self in all beings, from that one no aversion arises.

verses.devanagari: यस्मिन् सर्वाणि भूतान्यात्मैवाभूद्विजानतः । तत्र को मोहः कः शोक एकत्वमनुपश्यतः ॥
verses.iast: yasmin sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmaivābhūd vijānataḥ | tatra ko mohaḥ kaḥ śoka ekatvam anupaśyataḥ ||
verses.translation: For the knower in whom all beings have become the Self, what delusion, what grief is there for one who sees oneness?

verses.devanagari: स पर्यगाच्छुक्रमकायमव्रणमस्नाविरं शुद्धमपापविद्धम् । कविर्मनीषी परिभूः स्वयम्भूर्याथातथ्यान्यथार्थान् व्यदधाच्छाश्वतीभ्यः समाभ्यः ॥
verses.iast: sa paryagāc chukram akāyam avraṇam asnāviraṁ śuddham apāpa-viddham | kavir manīṣī paribhūḥ svayambhūr yāthātathyato 'rthān vyadadhāc chāśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ ||
verses.translation: He has encompassed all—effulgent, bodiless, woundless, sinewless, pure, untouched by evil—seer, thinker, transcendent, self-existent, who allotted things rightly from ages everlasting.

verses.devanagari: अन्धं तमः प्रविशन्ति येऽसम्भूतिमुपासते । ततो भूय इव ते तमो या उ सम्भूत्या रताः ॥
verses.iast: andhaṁ tamaḥ praviśanti ye 'sambhūtim upāsate | tato bhūya iva te tamo yā u sambhūtyāṁ ratāḥ ||
verses.translation: Into blind darkness they enter who worship the Unmanifest; into a darkness seeming greater go those who delight only in becoming.

verses.devanagari: अन्यदेवाहुः सम्भवादन्यदाहुरसम्भवात् । इति शुश्रुम धीमानां ये नस्तद्विचचक्षिरे ॥
verses.iast: anyad evāhuḥ sambhavād anyad āhur asambhavāt | iti śuśruma dhīmānāṁ ye nas tad vicacakṣire ||
verses.translation: Different indeed, they say, is what comes from becoming; and different, they say, from non-becoming. So have we heard from the wise who explained it to us.
